sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• Safinamide has centralized marketing authorization by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for use in the European Union.
  • Parkinson's disease: 50 mg ORALLY once daily; may increase to 100 mg/day

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: Safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• Renal impairment: No adjustment is needed
  • Hepatic impairment, mild (Child-Pugh score 5 or 6): No adjustment needed
  • Hepatic impairment, moderate (Child-Pugh score 7 to 9): Use lower dose of 50 mg/day
  • Hepatic impairment, severe (Child-Pugh score 10 to 15): Contraindicated for use
  • Elderly: No adjustment required; not studied in patients 75 years and older

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• Albinism, retinal degeneration, uveitis, inherited retinopathy, or severe progressive diabetic retinopathy
  • Concomitant use of other MAOIs; discontinue use at least 7 days prior to initiating MAOI therapy
  • Concomitant use of pethidine; discontinue use at least 7 days prior to initiating pethidine
  • Hypersensitivity to safinamide or any component of the product
  • Severe hepatic impairment

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Hepatic:
  • -- Moderate hepatic impairment; dosage adjustment recommended; discontinue use if progresses to severe; use contraindicated in patients with severe hepatic impairment
  • Ophthalmic:
  • -- Ophthalmological history with increased risk for retinal effects (eg, family history of hereditary retinal disease, retinitis pigmentosa, active retinopathy, uveitis); increased risk for retinal degeneration; use not recommended
  • Psychiatric:
  • -- Impulse control disorders (eg, obsessive thoughts, compulsions, pathological gambling, hypersexuality, compulsive spending) may occur
  • Reproductive:
  • -- Women of childbearing potential; adequate contraception required during use
  • Concomitant Use:
  • -- Avoid concomitant use with fluoxetine or fluvoxamine and let 5 half-lives of the SSRI lapse prior to initiating use
  • -- Concomitant use with BCRP substrates with a Tmax of 2 hours or less (eg, pitavastatin, pravastatin, ciprofloxacin, methotrexate, topotecan, diclofenac, glyburide); allow an interval of at least 5 hours between dosing
  • -- Concomitant use with dextromethorphan not recommended
  • --When used as an adjunct to levodopa, exacerbation of preexisting dyskinesia and potentiation of levodopa side effects may occur; a levodopa dose reduction may be required; this effect was not observed in patients with early stage Parkinson disease

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Neurologic:Dyskinesia (1% to less than 10%), Insomnia (1% to less than 10%)
Serious
  • Cardiovascular:Myocardial infarction (0.01% to less than 0.1%), Prolonged QT interval (0.1% to less than 1%)
  • Dermatologic:Basal cell carcinoma of skin (0.1% to less than 1%)
  • Hematologic:Leukopenia (0.1% to less than 1%)
  • Psychiatric:Impulse control disorder, Restlessness (0.1% to less than 1%)
  • Other:Falls (1% to less than 10%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Safinamide is a selective and reversible MAO-B inhibitor that increases extracellular levels of dopamine in the striatum. Safinamide also inhibits voltage-gated sodium channels and modulates stimulated release of glutamate.

sub.title: Metabolism
sub.mono:
• Liver: Primary site
  • Safinamide acid (major): Inactive
  • Inhibitor of BCRP in the small intestine.

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Fecal: 1.5% changed
  • Renal excretion: 76% changed; less than 10% unchanged
  • Total body clearance: 4.6 L/hour

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
Take with water; may be given with or without food.

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: Improvement in the signs and symptoms of Parkinson disease may indicate efficacy.

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patient to report new or increased compulsions, obsessive thoughts, pathological gambling, libido, hypersexuality, impulsive behaviors, or compulsive buying and spending,
  • Side effects may include insomnia, dyskinesia, somnolence, dizziness, headache, cataracts, orthostatic hypotension, nausea, and falls.
  • Instruct patient to skip a missed dose and resume normal dosing schedule.
